description:
Suppress additional JS alerts on Cancel as well as on Accept.

BUG=26450
TEST=Load webpage with three JS alerts. Check "Prevent this page from creating
  additional dialogs" on the second, and Cancel that alert. Ensure that the
  third alert is not shown.

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=62543

messages.text:
I don't remember any deliberate decision to ignore the suppression checkbox on 'Cancel'. Anybody know of one?

- Pam

LGTM for views and gtk.

+thakis for cocoa (the code looks good, but since I never touched any cocoa code, is better to get someone from mac to review it).

A question: Did you test the behavior of this feature in Safari, IE and Firefox to see what they do in this case?

On 2010/10/13 16:08:49, tfarina wrote:
> LGTM for views and gtk.
> 
> +thakis for cocoa (the code looks good, but since I never touched any cocoa
> code, is better to get someone from mac to review it).
> 
> A question: Did you test the behavior of this feature in Safari, IE and Firefox
> to see what they do in this case?

None of Firefox (3.6.10), Safari (5.0.1), or IE (8.0) offers a way to suppress additional JS dialog boxes.

- Pam

subject: Suppress additional JS alerts on Cancel as well as on Accept....
